lead_paragraph: SUMMERS--Clive. Passed away Friday, March 25, 2016. Born in London, England, he moved to NYC in 1965 at the age of 21 to begin a successful career as one of the top hair stylists in the world. He was widely recognized for his talent, charm and wit. Clive's career spanned five decades starting at Cinandre as head stylist and then opening his own salon, Clive Summers in the Olympic Tower on Fifth Avenue, which became one of NYC's premiere salons. Following a two-year stint in retirement to the family home in Spain and to travel the world, he came back to NYC and opened Clive on 57th Street. A traveler, a mentor, a creator and visionary, he will be missed. But, most importantly he was an adoring husband to wife Lee and an always loving and humorous father to daughter Lisa and son Oliver. Memorial service will be this Friday, April 1st at 3pm at Frank E. Campbell, 1076 Madison Ave. 1/3
